item.title: The abondoned bin is still here. Please collect urgently, 24th December
item.description:
Reported via mobile in the Litter Bin - Move or Remove category anonymously at 09:54, Thursday 18 December 2025 Sent to Southwark Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 8563181. Photo of this report The brown bin does not belong to the street and appeared out of nowhere two days ago. Can you remove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Terrace, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface breaking down, again., 24th December
item.description:
This is an on-going defect in the road at the bus stop (R) outside Worth’s Bakery. No matter how many times it is repaired within about a week the surface is breaking down. It would appear that whoever the Council charges with the repair are using substandard tarmac, etc. One day a bus will pull into the bus stop and a wheel will actually completely break through and become totally stuck.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welling High Street, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing spotlights not working, 24th December
item.description:
The spotlights on the crossing are not working. This is particularly hard to see if pedestrians are waiting or starting to cross at nighttime, especially on the NB side where overhanging trees reduce light levels further.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins not collected in over a month, 24th December
item.description:
I called to report this to Sanctuary Housing and found out that our estate doesn’t even have a collection schedule currently. They assured me this would be resolved, however it’s now coming up to the end of the year and it still yet been sorted.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping still not removed after being reported over 8 weeks ago, 24th December
item.description:
Still hasn’t been removed - will ask Councellor Georgio to visit as seems he is the only one that concerns himself with the state of the borough. Your road sweepers have passed this and yet they do nothing. Out Council Tax obviously going to waste again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes Road, New Southgate, Greater London
